text.content: Slice and pound the veal cutlets until thin. Place a slice of prosciutto crudo and a sage leaf on each cutlet.
Secure with a toothpick. Melt 40 g of butter and 20 g of oil in a pan over medium-high heat.
Lightly flour the veal slices on one side only. Place them in the hot pan and increase temperature to brown the saltimbocca. Pepper to taste, do not add salt.
Once browned, deglaze with white wine and let the alcohol evaporate. Cover and cook for 1 minute. Transfer the saltimbocca to a plate and keep warm.
In the same pan, add 10 g of butter and 20 ml of water to the cooking liquid. Reduce until a slightly thick sauce forms.
Pour the sauce onto a serving plate and arrange the veal cutlets on top. Serve the saltimbocca hot.
